As a Kashmiri with a heart full of pain💔, I want to say — we are devastated and deeply mourn the Pahalgam attack. But please, I plead with folded hands, don’t blame all of us for the cruelty committed by a few.
Kashmir has always opened its heart and soul for everyone. Tourists who visit us are not just visitors — they become part of our families. We serve them with love, feed them from our kitchens, protect them with our lives. Even during this tragic attack, brave Kashmiris risked everything to save innocent lives — because humanity flows through our veins.
Yet, despite our love and kindness, it breaks our hearts when our own children — Kashmiri students studying outside — are targeted, bullied, and humiliated for crimes they never committed. They are looked at with suspicion, mistreated, and made to feel like outsiders in their own country.
Why this injustice? Why are we judged for the acts we condemn just as much as you do?
We Kashmiris have cried endless tears. We have lost countless lives. We know the deep wound of grief better than anyone.
Please, don’t let the actions of a few evil minds bury the compassion of millions. Please, don’t let hate win.
Trust us — we stand for peace, for love, for humanity.
We are with you, not against you.
Our hearts bleed with yours.💔"

I want to share my personal opinion on this video — you have explained this case very well, but in my view, you should not have revealed the methods used to catch the terrorist. बिलकुल। पुलवामा हमले (14 फरवरी 2019) में शहीद हुए जवानों में कुछ मुस्लिम सैनिकों के नाम इस प्रकार हैं:

1. मौलाना मुहम्मद हाफिज सईद (CRPF) – कश्मीर के रहने वाले थे।


2. अब्दुल मुजीब – जम्मू-कश्मीर या उत्तर भारत से थे (कुछ रिपोर्टों में नाम ज़िक्र हुआ है)।


3. अजाज़ अहमद – एक अन्य शहीद जिनका नाम रिपोर्ट्स में आया था।



हालांकि, हर न्यूज़ रिपोर्ट में सभी शहीदों की पूरी डिटेल नहीं दी जाती, लेकिन यह स्पष्ट है कि भारत के सभी धर्मों के सैनिकों ने देश के लिए जान दी है – चाहे वो हिंदू हों, मुस्लिम, सिख या ईसाई।

इससे ये भी साबित होता है कि देशभक्ति का कोई धर्म नहीं होता, और भारत की फौज सभी भारतीयों की फौज है।

Dr. B.R. Ambedkar made some sharp statements regarding Muslims and secularism, suggesting that in his view, there was no place for secular elements within an "Islamic polity." He wrote, "None of the secular categories of life has any place in the politics of the Muslim community," and also stated, "Islam can never allow a true Muslim to adopt India as his motherland and regard a Hindu as his kith and kin." These statements indicate that while Ambedkar did not directly say that "Muslims can't follow secularism," he asserted that Muslim communal politics and secularism cannot coexist.

📘 Key Quotations and Their Sources

1. "None of the secular categories of life have any place in the politics of the Muslim community..."

This statement appears in Chapter X of Pakistan or the Partition of India, where Ambedkar discusses the role of religion in Muslim political life. He argues that secular considerations are often subordinated to religious principles within Muslim politics.


2. "Islam can never allow a true Muslim to adopt India as his motherland and regard a Hindu as his kith and kin."

This quote is from Chapter XII, Part V of the same book. Ambedkar expresses concerns about the potential challenges of national integration, suggesting that religious teachings might influence a Muslim's sense of national identity.

Hey Natish, Lets talk about the surgical strike you mentioned 

High-resolution satellite images from Planet Labs Inc., reviewed by Reuters, showed that structures at the targeted site in Balakot remained intact days after the airstrike. Experts like Jeffrey Lewis from the Middlebury Institute of International Studies noted no visible signs of bomb damage, such as holes in roofs or scorched walls, which would be expected if large munitions had struck the buildings 

Further analyses by the Australian Strategic Policy Institute and the Atlantic Council's Digital Forensics Research Lab corroborated these findings, indicating no apparent evidence of extensive damage and suggesting possible targeting errors during the strike

Conclusion: 

While India asserted that the Balakot airstrike inflicted substantial damage on militant infrastructure, independent satellite imagery and on-the-ground reports have not corroborated these claims. The lack of publicly available evidence has led international observers to question the extent of the strike's impact.
